Deficiency Narrative: Operation was notified of a children's rights deficiency on 06/05/25 and notification to parent/guardian was not made on or before 06/10/25.  Notifications were sent to the parents/guardians on 06/24/25.
Correction Narrative: Operation provided a compliance plan following the citation. Operation states that notifications have been completed as of 06/24/2025. Corrective actions include quarterly trainings for all staff with access to provider portal regarding parent notification and form 7266 requirements. Weekly internal audits will be completed to ensure all requirements are completed and monthly compliance report is submitted to the Administrator or Program director. Tasks and items needing completion after a citation or validation of findings are clearly documented and standardized.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member told a child that they "deserved it" after that child was in a physical altercation with another child.
Correction Narrative: Two children interviewed confirmed staff does not talk to them in a harsh, cruel or unnecessary, or demeaning manner.

Deficiency Narrative: Based on a review of documentation, it was determined that a child's unauthorized absence was not reported to the parent within the required timeframe.
Correction Narrative:
07/24/2025-The operation's LCCA submitted the corrective action plan to Licensing via email indicating the operation will be reviewing serious incident reporting protocols with staff as well as retraining all supervisory staff on the reporting requirements by July 30, 2025. 

The operation's LCCA indicated a tracking log will be implemented to document both parent and Licensing notifications for every AWOL event, including timestamps effective date of July 30, 2025.

Deficiency Narrative: Upon request from Licensing, the operation did not furnish or make the requested child record (runaway prevention safety plan) accessible for review.
Correction Narrative:
07/24/2025-The operation's LCCA submitted the corrective action plan to Licensing via email indicating the operation has reviewed documentation access procedures as well as will ensure that all requested records are immediately available for Licensing review. 

The operation's LCCA indicated the operation will be transitioning to a full digital system as well as all records will be available on the operation's platform.  

Additionally, the operation's LCCA reported staff will be retrained on proper file organization and access protocols by July 30, 2025.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation did not have the evaluation of unauthorized absences available for review by Licensing.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a compliance plan by email on 05/27/2025. Operation states that the operation will implement an overall evaluation of runaways per standard 748.453(e). Operation will review all these runaway incidents and document the review.

Deficiency Narrative: 5 out of 10 serious incident reports reviewed identified incidents as both serious and reportable but the incidents were not reported to the Texas Abuse & Neglect Hotline.
Correction Narrative:
Corrective Action 
Assessment & Development 
-Collect data on past incidents to understand the frequency and nature of reporting delays.
-Determine why serious incidents are not being reported promptly (e.g., lack of awareness of procedures, inadequate training, communication breakdowns, etc.).

Update Incident Reporting Procedures
-Revise policies to clearly define the steps and timelines for reporting serious incidents, including suicide attempts, to Licensing.
-Develop a flowchart or checklist that outlines the reporting process step-by-step.
-Establish a clear communication plan that ensures all staff are informed of the minimum standards and understand their roles in the reporting process.

Training 
-Develop a comprehensive training program for all staff on recognizing and reporting serious incidents in a timely manner.
-Emphasize the importance of timely reporting and the specific requirements of regulation 748.303(a)(12)(A).

Monitoring & Compliance
-Establish a schedule for weekly audits of incident reports to ensure compliance with reporting timelines.
-Use a checklist to verify that all serious incidents are reported to Licensing promptly.
-Implement a system of accountability where staff members are held responsible for delays or failures in reporting.
-Provide the Texas Abuse & Neglect Hotline phone number for all relevant staff.

Deficiency Narrative: Medication was observed not in a locked container.
Correction Narrative:
Corrective Action
Assessment of Current Medication Storage Practices
-Conduct an immediate review of current medication storage methods across the facility.
-Identify all locations where medications are stored.
-Determine whether existing storage complies with the locked container requirement.

Implementation of Secure Storage Solutions
-Ensure all medications are stored in appropriate locked containers.
-Purchase lockable storage units or upgrade current storage to include locks, if necessary.
-Ensure the designated storage area for medications is separate from general storage or high-traffic areas.
-Label storage units clearly to prevent misuse or confusion.

Staff Training
-Train staff on proper medication storage and access procedures.
-Conduct mandatory training sessions emphasizing the importance of secure storage.
-Provide written guidelines outlining medication handling and storage requirements.
-Include procedures for checking locks and ensuring compliance during daily operations.

Regular Inspections and Monitoring
-Implement a schedule for routine inspections of medication storage areas by lead staff.
-Conduct weekly checks to verify all medications are stored in locked containers.
-Use a checklist to document compliance and identify any issues or staff concerns.
-Address non-compliance immediately by retraining staff or replacing faulty storage units.

Emergency Access Procedures
-Develop and communicate procedures for accessing medication in emergencies.
-Assign key staff for medication storage units.
-Maintain a log of authorized personnel with access to storage keys or combinations.
-Train staff on emergency access protocols to ensure medications can be retrieved promptly when needed.

Documentation and Record-Keeping
-Maintain accurate records of medication storage and access.
-Use a logbook to record when medications are added, accessed, refused, or removed.
-Document storage inspections and any corrective actions taken.
-Document medication destruction 

Policy Update and Communication
-Update the facilityÂ’s written medication storage policy to reflect regulatory requirements.
-Distribute the updated policy to all staff and review it during staff meetings.
-Post the policy in medication storage areas for easy reference.

Deficiency Narrative: Recreational calendars provided for the past 90 days did not outline an indoor & outdoor recreational activity.
Correction Narrative:
Corrective Action
 Assessment of Current Practices
-Conduct a review of existing recreational schedules, resources, and activities.
-Evaluate whether current activities meet the developmental, physical, and emotional needs of children.
-Identify gaps in indoor/outdoor activity offerings.

Comprehensive Activity Plan
-Create a detailed schedule that includes daily indoor and outdoor activities tailored to the childrenÂ’s diverse needs and interests.
-Discuss with staff, caregivers, and children to gather input on desired activities and interests.
-Incorporate structured and unstructured activities, ensuring a balance of active, creative, and relaxing options.
-Plan for weather-appropriate alternatives for outdoor activities.

Staff Training 
-Train staff on their roles in implementing and supervising recreational activities.
-Educate staff on the importance of encouraging recreation for child development.
-Assign specific responsibilities, such as activity leaders or coordinators.

Necessary Resources
-Ensure the availability of equipment, materials, and spaces for activities.
-Conduct an inventory of current supplies and identify needs purchase needed items
-Designate safe indoor and outdoor spaces for activities.

Implementation of Daily Activities
-Implement the new daily activity schedule.
-Post schedules in visible areas for staff and children.
-Monitor participation to ensure engagement.

Monitoring and Improvement
-Regularly monitor activity and make improvements as needed.
-Gather feedback from children and staff regarding the activities.
-Adjust the schedule based on feedback and observations.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walkthrough a  bag of rice and potatoes were stored in a contatiner on the floor in the pantry.
During the walkthrough a dresser in one of the boys room had two missing dressers.
The unauthorized absence log does not indicate how long the child was gone from the operation.
Correction Narrative: St. Georgia's GRO maintains an Unauthorized Absence Annual Summary Log to document unauthorized absences of youth placed at the facility. The individual logs include documentation of the date and time that the youth were noted as being absent from and returned to the facility. The duration of the youth's absence could be derived from these data points, which were recorded at the times of each respective incident. A new line will be added to the updated Unauthorized Absence Annual Summary Log to include the amount of time for the absence from the operation and if the youth discharged from the facility without returning.

Deficiency Narrative: After reviewing the documents provided, the childÂ’s Preliminary Service Plan noted multiple pronouns when referring to the child, an SIR provided did not include the circumstances surrounding the incident, an SIR provided did not depict the resolution of the incident, an SIR provided did not record the childÂ’s date of admission and a document submitted as the suicide screening did not have the name of the document, the name of the child nor did it have a date recorded on it.
Correction Narrative: As per the Administrator, due to a transition between LCCAÂ’s, the pronouns for the resident were changed due to an oversight. A tab has added to include pronouns in their system to avoid any confusion. The operationÂ’s plan to address this is to ensure that residents identify their pronouns during the Admissions Assessment. The pronoun provided will be used on all assessments moving forward. An Admission Assessment was also provided with the added slot for pronouns. An additional Admissions Assessment was also provided to reflect a more detailed sample addressing the treatment services a childÂ’s will be provided while in the care of the operation. Any and all documents will be detailed enough to provide the required information and will be reviewed and approved by the Administrator to ensure compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: It was reported by the operation that a Suicide Screening was not completed related to the incident regarding this investigation. In addition, a Suicide Screening was also not conducted for a previous incident as reported by the operation.
Correction Narrative: As per the Administrator, a trigger has been added to Extend Reach, platform for documentation. In the event a child is admitted to the hospital, the trigger will trigger a suicide screening for 30 days after admission. A Suicide Screening Assessment that will be used by the operation was provided reflecting where the childÂ’s name and their pertinent information is to be documented.
